entry.title: lovefool
entry.summary:
Author: oneofthesirens

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,495Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 8

Summary: “Oh my God,” Buck says as cold, certain clarity seeps through him. “I know why I’m upset.” He can barely bring himself to open his eyes. When he finally manages to find the courage, he sees Ravi looking at him with eager anticipation. “Yes?” Ravi prompts, leaning forward. He waves a hand encouragingly at Buck. “Go on?” “I think,” Buck says slowly, “I’m in love with Hen.”Or: Buck wildly misinterprets his jealousy over Hen and Eddie being partners.

entry.title: Evergrowing
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 176,643Chapters: 29/?Kudos: 18

Summary: Athena and Bobby are learning that parenting doesn’t end when the kids turn eighteen. With three grown children and two still at home, Bobby and Athena find themselves navigating new challenges at every stage of life. Each child carries their own struggles, some spoken and some hidden, but together the family works through the ups and downs with love, patience, and resilience. At the heart of it all, they’re reminded that family is a bond that grows, shifts, and deepens, no matter how old the kids get.

entry.title: Calls From The Past
entry.summary:
Author: Lady_Stardust1979

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 25,101Chapters: 6/9Kudos: 80

Summary: "Busying himself with the envelope in his hands as an excuse not to help, he studied the letter in his hand. It was a small envelope, small enough to fit a postcard, just like the ones he used to send Maddie. In black ink, his full name was inscribed in a deliberate stroke; neat and smooth, not unhurried or hesitant. Turning the envelope over, Buck froze as his eyes snagged on the neat handwriting. Just above the return address was a name that Buck certainly would not have expected to have seen written there in a million years. James Abernanthy."   ____________________   What if Eddie Diaz was not the first friend that Buck ever fell in love with? What if he had a history of falling for his 'straight best friend' but repressed the shit out of it? With his old friend sending him letters, asking for his forgiveness and a second chance, Buck has to reconcile with what this means for him. --> set around the start of 8A but the plot has been completely botched for creative writing purposes

entry.title: Everything I Didn’t Say
entry.summary:
Author: Iceprincess96

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,810Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 1

Summary: When Eddie bails on a post-shift drink to drop Chris off, Buck ends up out with Ravi instead. One too many beers and one too many conversations about “missing Eddie” later, Ravi decides to play wingman — and Buck wakes up the next morning remembering a night of unexpected heat with a couple he met at the bar. It’s harmless, fun, something to laugh about later. Until Eddie overhears the story. Jealousy hits him like a truck. He hates how Buck’s laughter sounds when he talks about someone else, hates how Ravi looks so proud of himself, hates how he’s supposed to act like none of it matters when it matters more than anything. Somewhere between anger and heartbreak, Eddie realizes the truth: he’s not just jealous. He’s in love with Buck.And when that realization finally explodes, it takes everything down with it — before it builds something entirely new.   Title - 5SOS everything I didn’t say

entry.title: In Another Life
entry.summary:
Author: whiskey_princess13

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 21,754Chapters: 8/?Kudos: 22

Summary: “Your father’s been relocated for work.” Margaret speaks up, sitting down at one of the chairs by the island. “Rel- What does that mean?” Evan stands in the doorway, one hand on the wall. “Are we- Are we moving?” “Yes.” Phillip responds simply. “My boss wants me down in Texas in two weeks, so we’ve already got the house listed.” “Two- *Two weeks?!* Evan stands up straighter, crossing his arms over his chest. “What about school? I’m in the middle of summer school!” “We’ve talked with your principal already. He’s transferring your credits over to La Salle High School in El Paso. You start there next month when school starts.” -------Or, The buckley's move down to texas where Evan meets Eddie and Shannon in high school and they become a close knit trio of friends

entry.title: To Have a Life Worthy of Death
entry.summary:
Author: James_Madison_617

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,024Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 110

Summary: Buck was fifteen when he realized he would be dying alone. He’d always assumed he’d die young and probably by his own hand either intentionally or by some stupid attention seeking stunt. He’ll live. He’ll die. Then nothing after that really mattered since it’s not like he was going to be there anyway. Who would come to his funeral? What would they do? Would they share stories? Would they show pictures of him up on a screen like how they did at a few others he’d been to? Would his parents make a big deal out of it? In the halls of his school, he handed out high fives like they were candy, giving people personalized greetings and stopping to chat for a few seconds before they both had to get going. He wasn’t just loved, he was adored. He couldn’t just stop there though. That didn’t get you far. That only got you a page in the yearbook dedicated to you and possibly a photo in a display case for a few years with a plaque saying “in loving memory of…”. Really his funeral would only be full of empty words and maybe a few tears.  Or, Buck is just waiting until he's sure his funeral is full before he dies and Eddie's reaction once he finds out

Author: inkinmyheartandonthepage

Summary: Buck switched over the voice mails, a smile tugging at his lips. “Buck,” Eddie’s voice heard of the chatter of the airport. “What do you mean dinner is in the fridge? Answer your phone please.” The next one came nearly an hour later. “Buck!” Eddie hissed down the phone. “Are you serious right now? I – shit Buck! Thank you. Thank you so – god you are so… oh fuck. I – god damn it Buck!” Buck laughed at that one, shaking his head. OR Buck cooks Thanksgiving dinner for Eddie and Eddie has his OH moment.
